meanings.definition: To break or crush with the teeth
meanings.sent2: The dog cranched the bone into small pieces.
meanings.sent3: The sound of her cranched chips echoed in the room.
meanings.sent4: His anger cranched through his words.
meanings.sent5: The old machine cranched the gears together.

meanings.definition: To make a loud crunching noise
meanings.sent1: The leaves cranched under his feet as he walked.
meanings.sent2: The branches cranched loudly in the wind.
meanings.sent3: The kids laughed as they cranched through the snow.
meanings.sent4: The car cranched over the gravel road.
meanings.sent5: The thunder cranched through the sky.

meanings.sent1: He cranched on the popcorn during the movie.
meanings.sent2: The cows cranched on the grass in the field.
meanings.sent3: She cranched on the gum, making a funny noise.
meanings.sent4: The toddler cranched on the carrot sticks happily.
meanings.sent5: The students cranched on their snacks during the break.

meanings.definition: To cause to make a crunching noise
meanings.sent1: The weight of the snow cranched the branches of the tree.
meanings.sent2: The pressure cranched the plastic bottle.
meanings.sent3: The wind cranched the old sign hanging outside.
meanings.sent4: The force cranched the metal rod.
meanings.sent5: The impact cranched the glass window.
